medical_history.chief_complaint: Epigastric tightness and pressure with nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began today with intense pressure that radiated to her back, similar to a previous episode. No shortness of breath was reported. Symptoms were aggravated after lunch when she did not take her Zantac, resulting in discomfort and vomiting. She later managed to keep down a dose of medication at 5 PM, after which her symptoms began to improve.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Grave's disease, not on medications for some time. TSH during pregnancy has been within normal limits, but increased from 1.4 to 3.4 at an unspecified prior date. Past surgical history includes laparoscopy for ectopic pregnancy and knee surgery.
